intro: Galium boreoaethiopicum, commonly known as the northern Ethiopian bedstraw, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Ethiopia and Eritrea. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant features slender, erect stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Galium boreoaethiopicum is adapted to high-altitude environments and thrives in moist, shaded habitats.
